How to find Impalers in Helldivers 2


To find an Impaler in Helldivers 2, you’re more likely to encounter them at level 7– Suicide Mission– and higher. While they may be encountered at lower levels, they are a lot less frequent to come by.  


They look like a larger variant of the standard Charger, but blue and spiky. Impalers also have darker orange underbellies, so you have to be careful when encountering them in hordes.


These tend to come out on main objectives or when the mission timer gets closer to 0. Much like the rest of the Terminids yo…
articles.title: Helldivers 2: How to find and beat Impalers

articles.author: Cameron Woolsey
articles.description:
Another Activision dandy is on its way to Game Pass, in the form of a Wumpa-fruit-munching marsupial. Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy, a remake of the original trilogy, highlights the list of games coming to Game Pass in August 2024.


Crash isn't hopping onto the ol' Pass on his lonesome. In the announcement post made today over at Xbox Wire, the Game Pass team confirms that Mafia: Definitive Edition and Creatures of Ava are also on the way. The latter, in fact, will arrive on the service tomorrow as a day-one launch game. Naturally, this means that subscribers will only be able to play Creatures of Ava if they have the more expensive Game Pass Ultimate. 


Crash isn't the first to crash onto Xbox Game Pass in August


Creatures of Ava will launch for Xbox Game Pass tomorrow, August 7. As…
articles.title: Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy highlights Game Pass releases for August 2024

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
EA and Respawn have set a September 17, 2024 launch date for the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One versions of Star Wars Jedi: Survivor. If you've been holding out for the day Cal Kestis once again graces the previous generation of consoles, your wait is almost over.


Digital pre-orders are live for the PS4 and Xbox One versions, which clock in a little cheaper than their current-gen counterparts. This one has been optimized specifically for the capabilities of the respective platforms, and it's priced at $49.99. Those who pre-order will get a Combustion Blaster and an Obi-Wan-inspired robe. 




Star Wars Jedi: Survivor first launched on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and EA App on April 28, 2023. It essentially took what 2019's Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order offered and gave us way more of the good stuff. 


Speaking of good stuff, Respawn is hoping to inject more of it into the PC port. When it initially launched, it was buggy and messed up enough to warrant an apology. Improvements have been made since, and the latest press release says more enhancements are on the way "in the coming weeks."


The upcoming patch promises updates to technical performance, controls, and other features. Players can also look forward to "a variety of quality-of-life improvements" when the fixes go live. Here's hoping everything goes smoothly both for the PC version and the previous-gen consoles, which have a pretty beefy game on their hands with this one. 

The post Star Wars Jedi: Survivor squeezes onto PS4, Xbox One on September 17 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Star Wars Jedi: Survivor squeezes onto PS4, Xbox One on September 17

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
After 10 years, Elder Scrolls Online is still going strong. It will remind you of that like clockwork, as each year it kicks off events both new and old. Hopefully, we can help you manage your schedule.


Below is an outline of events scheduled for ESO both tentative and concrete. Some have passed, some haven’t been announced, some have, and others we can predict because they’re annual. Here is all the details on what’s happening in Tamriel.


Ongoing events in 2024



Vvardenfell & Clockwork City 10th Anniversary Spotlight (July 2-August 15)


Portals of Oblivion 10th Anniversary Spotlight (August 5-September 3)



Upcoming events in 2024



Gilded Glory Mini Event (August 8–August 13)


Battlegrounds Crazy King Mini Event (August 15–August 20)


Update 43 PC/Mac Launch (August 19)



Exp…
articles.title: Every scheduled ESO event, ongoing and scheduled for 2024

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
If you've begun the Shards Request mission, you'll likely be puzzled by the resource's mysterious locations. They aren't exactly out in the open like other items, given that they must be unearthed with specific tools. So, if you want to complete the quest and earn crafting materials, here's how to get Shards in Fields of Mistria.


Where to find Shards and Dig Sites in Fields of Mistria


Use your shovel on a Dig Site to get Shards in the Fields of Mistria. If you haven't obtained this tool yet, the General Store sells a Worn Shovel for 500 Tesserae. I've had the most luck finding the Shards at the Western Ruins site, located to the left of the Narrows.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Go to the south side of the Western Ruins to find an archeology area. You should see a dig spot where you'll need to use your shovel. However, keep in mind that Shards don't always drop, and you may end up with another item instead.


Screenshot by Destructoid


One Dig Site will spawn at the Western Ruins daily, so check back on this destination for more Shards. If you want to increase the digging spots there, speak to Caldarus (the dragon statue) and unlock the Western Ruins Scholar perk. It will spawn an additional spot to farm more resources. 


Shards may appear in other areas, like the mines, whenever there's a Dig Site to uncover. I haven't had much luck outside of the Western Ruins, but it could still be possible. The material can also be used for crafting, along with the Shards Request. I suggest saving some for yourself for a future build in case it's needed again.

The post How to get Shards in Fields of Mistria appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get Shards in Fields of Mistria

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Hooded Horse and Eremite Games have provided a preview of Against the Storm’s upcoming 1.4 patch. This major update will bring major content additions to the base game. However, its release date has not yet been announced.


The major focus of the 1.4 patch is to bring in additional resources and production. The marquee feature here is fishing, which is done at ponds. These are resource nodes, much like many of the others that already exist within the game world. These are exploited using fishing huts.


There are also new buildings, resources, needs, and orders. With the addition of new resources and blueprints, Eremite Games acknowledges that this could result in bloat. The random (near-roguelite) nature of Against the Storm requires that you make effective use of what’s available to you…
articles.title: Against the Storm’s upcoming 1.4 patch brings delicious fish and glue

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Roblox The Games continues to draw in hype as each team's points skyrocket daily. By supporting your team through completing quests, many experiences like Dress to Impress have a new layer of fun and complexity to make things more interesting. Let's check out all five Shine locations in Roblox The Games' Dress to Impress experience.


All five shine locations in Roblox The Games' Dress to Impress


The Shines in Roblox The Games' version of Dress to Impress range in locations, from the dressing rooms to the intermission screen. You'll even have to show off your parkour skills as you jump across nail polish and mascara bottles to get the fifth and final Shine. 


Shine one


Screenshot by Destructoid


The first Shine is in the dressing room, where you design your clothes. When you spawn, y…
articles.title: Roblox The Games: Where to find all 5 shines in Dress to Impress

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The RIAA and several other organizations condemn AI startup Anthropic for allegedly flaunting copyright law. The criticism appears in an amicus brief in support of a court injunction requested by music publishers, who want the AI company to stop using lyrics without permission. According to the RIAA, Anthropic's defense relies on the same rhetoric as Napster once did.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RIAA Backs AI Copyright Lawsuit Against Anthropic, Sees Similarities with Napster

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Uruguay's Ministry of Industry issued a decree in October 2022 which heralded the country's first pirate site blocking program. Since then the country has blocked over 300 pirate domains following requests from various broadcasters. Some other figures of interest; in December 2022, there were around 573,000 pay TV subscribers in Uruguay. A year later that figure had fallen to 496,000. Pay TV revenues were less affected than one might expect.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Site Blocking Can’t Prevent Pay TV Subscriber Decline in Uruguay

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Internet provider Cox Communications wants a do-over of the piracy liability trial, where it was ordered to pay $1 billion in damages to the record label plaintiffs. The ISP previously argued that 'concealed' evidence warrants a new look at the case. According to the music companies, however, Cox is grasping at straws, relying on speculation in the hope of getting a do-over.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Record Labels Ask Court to Deny Cox’s Challenge of ‘$1 Billion’ Piracy Verdict

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The mayor of a small municipality in Brazil recently hosted a public screening of the blockbuster hit "Inside Out 2". The open-air town square event was a great success, but not without critique. Watermarks on the meters-high screen showed that the public was watching a pirated copy of the film.  When the press got wind of it, the major countered that "everyone was happy", which is hard to argue with, especially since there are no official cinemas nearby.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Mayor Shows Pirated Copy of “Inside Out 2” on Town Square Big Screen in Brazil

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Six months after the launch of the Piracy Shield blocking system, it appears that IPTV piracy hasn't been defeated as planned. As a result, telecoms regulator AGCOM has summoned Google and Cloudflare to an official meeting to hear all about their plans to defeat piracy. The Italian Competition and Market Authority recently launched an antitrust investigation against Google, so the meeting in September will take place under dark clouds.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Google & Cloudflare Summoned to Explain Their Plans to Defeat Pirate IPTV

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'A Quiet Place: Day One' tops the chart, followed by 'Deadpool & Wolverine'. 'Bad Boys: Ride or Die' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 08/05/2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
In an effort to reduce online book piracy, publishers send millions of takedown notices every week. These enforcement efforts impact the availability of pirated content, but do they increase legitimate sales as well? According to academic field research, takedowns can increase sales of printed books with the right approach.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Taking Pirated Copies Offline Can Benefit Book Sales, Research Finds

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The Thai government's Department of Special Investigation (DSI) has carried out a major operation targeting the supply of pirated Premier League football streams, illegal gambling, and associated money laundering. A total of 21 raids, in five regions of the country, includes one that targeted an office hidden in a car wash.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Premier League Pirates Caught Offside as Police Raid Their Car Wash Base

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Several prominent football leagues and organizations, including UEFA, the Premier League, and LaLiga, have sent a letter to X urging the social media platform to take live-streaming piracy more seriously. Supported by broadcasters, they are demanding more advanced anti-piracy features. According to the letter, lack of enforcement has turned X into the home of social media piracy. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sports Leagues See ‘X’ as the ‘Home of Social Media Piracy’

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
AI music generators Suno and Udio have filed their answers in response to separate copyright lawsuits filed by the major recording labels. Penned by the same law firm, the answers have much in common and, even at this early stage, show that the RIAA has a fight on its hands. Suno and Udio are welcoming discovery, noting that the law has always permitted comparable uses of copyrighted works.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Suno & Udio to RIAA: Your Music is Copyrighted, You Can’t Copyright Styles

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In 2015, Kim Dotcom filed 52 requests with New Zealand government departments to urgently disclose information to assist his case. After most of the requests were transferred to the Attorney General's office, Dotcom demanded damages for breaching his privacy. After nine years of courts handing down decisions and Dotcom filing appeal after appeal, the Court of Appeal has now denied Dotcom's request for special leave to appeal the High Court's dismissal of another appeal, against a Human Rights Tribunal's decision not to award damages.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Kim Dotcom Denied Leave to Appeal High Court’s Dismissal of His Appeal Against Human Rights Tribunal Decision

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The International Olympic Committee is working around the clock to protect its broadcasting rights. Over the past week, IOC has sent thousands of DMCA takedown notices to Google. They reveal that torrent sites are a problem of the past; live-streaming sites are the main concern now.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: IOC Sends Thousands of DMCA Notices to Deter ‘Olympics’ Piracy

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After years of plain sailing followed by several years of bad luck, two convicted IPTV operators in Sweden were sentenced to prison and ordered to pay rightsholders $18m in damages. On appeal, the men successfully argued that the amount was excessive and based on incorrect information. A dispute over an admin panel photograph led to damages being slashed by $7m.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV Ops See Damages Reduced By $7m, Admin Panel Evidence Fell Short

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Copyright holders' representatives frequently use DMCA subpoenas to compel online intermediaries to share personal details of alleged pirate site operators. Cloudflare is a popular target for these requests but according to the people behind popular adult site nhentai.net, DMCA subpoenas shouldn't apply to 'mere conduit' intermediaries.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Nhentai ‘Pirate’ Site Wants Court to Quash ‘Improper’ Cloudflare DMCA Subpoena

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Karaoke may not scale the heights of popularity it once did in the West, but after more than 50 years the format may still be generating around $5 billion a year for rightsholders. That may explain why Hong Kong Customs carried out a month-long crackdown, arrested 18 people, and for the very first time, seized hardware and remote servers powering an online karaoke streaming system.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: High-Tech Karaoke Piracy Crackdown, 18 Arrested and Streaming Servers Seized

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Recording first-run movies in cinemas, an activity commonly known as "camming", is seen as a major threat to filmmakers worldwide. In India, the practice was elevated to a criminal offense last year and law enforcement is on high alert. A few days ago, a camming suspect was caught in the act after the filming angle of a previous upload, reportedly identified the cinema and a 'hot seat'.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Indian Police Pinpoint Seat of Movie “Camming” Pirate by Analyzing the Film Angle’

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Despite suffering losses in a legal battle that has dragged on for years, German publishing giant Axel Springer is refusing to give up on its claim that ad blocking software illegally interferes with its business model. Thus far, Eyeo GmbH, the company behind Adblock Plus, has come out on top. However, with Axel Springer's reformulated claims now rooted firmly in copyright law, the stakes are high at Germany's highest court. A long-running lawsuit involving Sony and a cheat device may yet hold the answers.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Ad Blocking Infringes Copyright? Ancient Sony Cheat Lawsuit May Prove Pivotal

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The Olympic Games 2024 is well underway with France responsible for hosting and beaming the spectacular to a global audience. Unauthorized broadcasters, including pirate streaming sites and IPTV providers, are already finding themselves blocked by French ISPs, following legal action by the International Olympic Committee. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV Services Blocked For Pirating The Olympics

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
South Africa has been trying to update its copyright law for several years now. President Ramaphosa previously sent two bills back to the drawing broad, after U.S. copyright groups described the broad fair use exceptions as dangerous. While critique persists, the South African Government is now taking a firm stand, openly stating that broad fair use exceptions are a feature, not a bug.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: South Africa Rejects Copyright Lobby Critique, Defends Broad ‘Fair Use’ Exceptions
